sanskrit_verse:
ब्राह्मस्य तु क्षपाहस्य यत्प्रमाणं समासतः ।
एकैकशो युगानां तु क्रमशस्तन्निबोधत ॥ १.६८॥
transliteration:
brāhmasya tu kṣapāhasya yatpramāṇaṃ samāsataḥ |
ekaikaśo yugānāṃ tu kramaśastannibodhata || 1.68 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The measure of a single night and day of Brahma, in summary, is to be understood sequentially for each of the Yugas.
jurisprudential_principles: Causation aligned with sequential dharma manifestation
Capacity-based responsibility within temporal dharmic orders
Restoration logic through alignment with universal rhythm
Consciousness alignment via recognition of divine temporality
executable_legal_axioms: IF temporal action occurs THEN it must align with the governing yuga-dharmic framework
IF misalignment detected THEN initiate consciousness recalibration based on brahma-kala awareness
IF dispute involves time-bound conduct THEN adjudicate per sequential yuga-dharma not punitive codes
IF capacity deficit identified THEN assign corrective engagement with brahma-rasa until integrity restored
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Adjudication, all disputes involving temporal actions must recognize that time itself operates under Brahma's scale; therefore, judgment must reflect sequential yuga-dharmic principles rather than linear human constructs. Responsibility thresholds are determined by one’s attunement to these vast temporal rhythms.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality unfolds according to sequential yuga cycles governed by Brahma-time. Thus, any apparent disorder stems from disconnection from this sequence, requiring realignment而非 punishment. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional response through consciousness restoration, not retributive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Assign ritualized study of brahma-kala until cognitive realignment achieved
Initiate yagna practices synchronized with yuga-cycle timing
Facilitate guru-disciple transmission focused on time-consciousness awakening
Implement sattvic lifestyle protocols until natural resonance with brahma-rasa reestablished
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Time is Brahman, Dharma flows in sequence, Justice restores consciousness, Reality is non-punitive, and Consciousness alone is the ultimate adjudicator.
